feed.title: SAP Community - SAP ERP
feed.subtitle: SAP ERP Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Error stop occurred during SAP package import (tcode: SPAM) at AUTO_MOD_SPAU phase.
entry.content:
An error stop occurred during the package import process in SAP (transaction code: SPAM) at the AUTO_MOD_SPAU phase.

 

- Env.

SPAM 7.40/0081

 

- Target Components and Versions

SAP_BASIS: SAPKB74029 → SAPKB74030

SAP_GWFND: SAPK-74029INSAPGWFND → SAPK-74030INSAPGWFND

 

SPAM status: Error stop

Import Phase: AUTO_MOD_SPAU

 

During the import process to version 74030, a Runtime Error: DBSQL_INTERNAL_ERROR occurred.

I retried the import using the “Ignore General Error” option, but it stopped again at the same point.

 

The displayed message is as follows:

The termination occurred in the ABAP program "SAPRUPGM", in the routine "SELECT_DELETED_OBJECTS".
The main program was "SAPRUPRM".

entry.title: How to Print Multiple FB01 Customer Invoices as PDF in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
 
in our accounting department, we often post customer invoices manually using transaction FB01. After posting, these documents need to be printed or saved as PDF invoices.
 
Currently, the only way we know is quite cumbersome:
 
Go to FBL5N,
 
Select the relevant documents (set the checkboxes),
 
Choose Environment → Correspondence → Request,
 
Then again Environment → Correspondence → Display,
 
and finally print the PDF.
 
This process works, but it’s far from efficient when dealing with multiple invoices.
 
Question:
Is there a standard SAP transaction or report that allows printing multiple accounting documents (FB01) as PDFs in one go — for example, by providing a list of document numbers as input?
 
Or would this typically require a custom ABAP solution (e.g., a Z-report calling the print program with a specific correspondence type)?
 
Any advice or experience with this use case would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Verification of Payee (VoP)
entry.content:
Dear SAP, 

We would like to set up Verification of Payee  (VoP) in our SAP system ECC6.
Could you confirm whether you will also implement that for ECC6 please.

Do not hesitate to get back to me if you nedd more explanation.

Thank you.

Kind Regards

entry.title: T5UTKZ VA Marital Status Entry
entry.content:
Hi Support,

The BSI Marital Status grid does not include a marital status for Virginia (VA). However, in SAP table T5UTKZ, there is an incorrect entry for VA-marital status code 15: Married, Withhold at Single Rate. This entry should be removed, as VA does not define filing status on Form VA-4.

entry.title: Double GR Posting- Locking Issue
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am facing this issue recently, we have the control key as PP02(Auto GR), While completing the last operation in DM   yield is posted and then goods receipt is automatically posted. So when order Qty is 2, GR  Qty is 2 obviously.

But in some situations while DM posting the last operation locking issue occurs, causing the posting to occur in COGI. When we reprocess the COGI entry, another 101 movement is also triggered.

As a result, Order Qty is 2, GR posting is 4 -> 2Qty (MB31-AutoGR) and Second GR - 2QTY COGI.

Pls suggest me configuration changes which can be made to stop this issue.

entry.title: Fehlermeldung 06268 Mehrfachkontierung nicht erlaubt
entry.content:
Hallo SAP Spezialisten, ich habe den Fehler "06268 Mehrfachkontierung nicht erlaubt" nach einen SP Update erhalten. Daraufhin habe ich das Customizing angepasst von Verbrauchsbuchung P auf V, wie im Hinweis 1889731 beschrieben. Nun habe ich im System allerdings noch alte Bestellungen mit den "alten" Customizing und wenn ich diese anpassen oder ändern will, dann erhalte ich dennoch die Meldung 06268.

Ich kann die Bestellposition löschen und eine neue anlegen, sofern keine Buchungen (Anzahlung, Teilrechnung,...) stattgefunden haben. 

Wenn ich allerdings eine Buchung auf der Bestellposition habe, dann kann ich keine Änderungen am Preis, Positionstextergänzung, Pflege Auftragsbestätigung, Lieferterminanpassung machen. Gibt es eine Möglichkeit dieses Problem zu lösen?

Beste Grüße CR02

entry.title: Balance Carryforward - S/4 Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm currently facing an issue in the context of a support project on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition. The client has requested a custom field in the balance sheet to display consolidation adjustments by company code. However, during the balance carryforward process, the values in this custom field are not being transferred into the opening balance of the next fiscal year.

Do you know if this is standard behavior for custom fields in the Public Cloud Edition, or could it be related to a configuration setting?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: F107 - FINS_FI_CLS023 - Advanced valuation active; you can no longer use the old report
entry.content:
Hi everyone:

I'm in a SAP S/4HANA 2023 project and we have activated "advance valuation". But the thing is that "Perform Further Valuations" app and  F107 Valuation Run is working no more, and now shows this message:

------

Message No. FINS_FI_CLS023

Diagnosis

You tried to execute a closing job that is no longer supported. You have activated the new closing processes. That is why you can no longer run the classic valuations.

System Response

The system does not execute the job.

Procedure

You activate advanced valuation for the accounting principle and the company code in the activity Activate Advanced Valuation.

For more information, please read the documentation of the activity Activate Advanced Valuation.

------

Does anyone know which is the new transaction that replaces F107 and the new Fiori app that replaces Perform Further Valuations?

Best regards

entry.title: Difference between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order (3F0)
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use CO Production Orders for manufacturing cost management.
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, we understand that Scope Item 3F0 (PP Production Order) is used instead.

Could you please clarify:
1. What are the main functional differences between ECC CO Production Order and S/4HANA Public Cloud PP Production Order?
2. What functionalities are available in PP Production Order (3F0)?
3. What functionalities from ECC CO Production Order are NOT available in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
4. Are there any alternative approaches to cover the gap?

entry.title: Alternative to ECC Cost Planning Transactions (KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII) in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

In ECC, we use the following transactions for cost rate calculation:
- KP06: Cost input
- KP26: Quantity input
- KSPI: Unit price calculation
- KSII

We understand that in S/4HANA Public Cloud, the recommended apps are:
- F3162: Manage Cost Rates - Plan
- F3422: Manage Cost Rates - Actual

Questions:
1. Can we still use KP06, KP26, KSPI, KSII transactions in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. What functionalities are NOT available with F3162 and F3422 compared to the ECC transactions?
3. Our current process calculates the following standard rates using KP06/KP26/KSPI:
- Standard labor rate
- Standard factory overhead rate
- Standard subcontracting rate
- Standard product overhead rate
- Post-process common overhead rate

Can we achieve the same calculations using F3162/F3422 in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Automatic GL Account Substitution Based on Cost Center and GL Account in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
We are migrating from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Current ECC Process:
When posting costs to specific Cost Centers and GL Accounts, the system automatically converts and posts to designated GL accounts based on a conversion table.

Business Rules:
1. If Cost Center = R&D Department → automatically post to "Research & Development Expenses" GL account
2. If Cost Center = SGA AND GL Account = 9XX (SGA accounts) → automatically post to "Selling, General & Administrative Expenses (for P&L display)" GL account

Conversion happens in real-time during posting using a custom conversion table (Cost Center + GL Account → Target GL Account).

Questions:
1. Is this type of automatic GL account substitution possible in S/4HANA Public Cloud?
2. If yes, which app or scope item should we use?
3. What is the recommended approach for this requirement in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

entry.title: Internal Order Alternative in S/4HANA Public Cloud - Which Scope Item for BS Account Posting and Inv
entry.content:
In ECC, we use Internal Orders for:

1. Posting costs to BS accounts (e.g., Work in Process, Advances)
- Pool costs temporarily before allocation
- Code starting with "3"

2. Posting costs directly to P&L accounts (e.g., Cost Variances)
- Immediate expense recognition
- Code starting with "4"

3. Issuing inventory materials to these orders

We understand Internal Orders are not available in S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Questions:
1. Which Scope Item(s) can replace Internal Order functionality?
- We checked 35E (R&D Project Management) but it seems to support only P&L posting

2. Can any Scope Item support:
- Posting to BS accounts for cost pooling?
- Direct material issues from inventory?

3. What is the recommended approach for our requirements?

Current usage:
- Manufacturing industry
- R&D department uses these for expense management
- Need to pool costs in BS accounts before period-end allocation

entry.title: Unable to find mapping for “LinkToObj” field in OWOR (Production Orders) via SAP Service Layer
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m trying to update the field “LinkToObj” in the OWOR (Production Orders) table from “Sales Order” to “Production Order” using the SAP Service Layer with a PUT request.

However, I can’t find any corresponding property or mapping attribute for LinkToObj in the Service Layer metadata or documentation.

Has anyone managed to modify this field through the Service Layer, or know the correct field name or approach to do so?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: Best practices and process design for using Procurement Type “X” (Make-or-Buy) in SAP ERP
entry.content:
Hello SAP experts,

I’m currently working on a project dealing with the configuration and process implications of using Procurement Type “X” (both in-house and external procurement) for semi-finished and assembly materials in an SAP environment.

Our goal is to understand whether procurement type “X” can be implemented effectively and what process controls and reporting designs are needed to maintain costing accuracy, transparency, and audit compliance,  or whether using two separate material numbers (one for in-house, one for external) is the more sustainable approach.

In our analysis, we have identified advantages (e.g. reduced master data maintenance, simplified BOMs, flexible quota arrangements) and disadvantages (e.g. mixed costing, valuation inconsistencies, transparency and audit concerns, high coordination effort between SCM and Controlling).

I’d like to ask the community for insights or best practices on the following:

  1. Process design:
    What does a clean, transparent process for reconciling in-house and external procurement under procurement type “X” look like, especially regarding communication and data maintenance between SCM and Controlling?

  2. Costing and valuation:
    How do you handle mixed costing or valuation when the in-house/external ratio changes dynamically during the year? Are there SAP-standard functionalities or best-practice workarounds to ensure consistent costing and stock valuation?

  3. Reporting and traceability:
    What reporting setups or SAP tools (standard or custom) are commonly used to analyze internal vs. external shares under procurement type “X”?
    How do you maintain audit-proof transparency in such cases?

  4. Governance and system configuration:
    Are there recommended decision criteria or governance frameworks (e.g. when to use procurement type X vs. separate materials) used in practice to balance flexibility vs. compliance?

I’m particularly interested in learning from companies that successfully implemented procurement type X for Make-or-Buy scenarios without losing control over costing, valuation, and transparency.

Thank you in advance for your insights and experiences!
Best regards!

entry.title: Choosing Between SAP Cloud Private Edition and On-Premise for MM & EWM Certification
entry.content:
I’m an Industrial Engineer and new to the SAP field. I’ve recently completed practical training in SAP MM and am now planning to study for certification. However, I’m unsure whether to focus on the Cloud Private Edition or On-Premise version — both for SAP Sourcing and Procurement and SAP EWM.

Since I’m just starting my SAP career, I’d like to make the right choice based on your professional recommendation, as it will determine my learning and certification path.

In your opinion, which version is better to focus on for building a strong and future-oriented SAP career?

Thank you..

entry.title: Business has by mistake posted the credit memo with less than PO invoice quantity with same
entry.content:
Issue - 

Scenario - PO - 100 price -100 , GR - 100, invoice - quanity - 100, price - 300   by mistake business posted the credit memo for with quantity 30 with price - 300. Now business want the cancel the credit memo which is created incorrectly.  I have tried the cancel the credit memo but it is throughing the error tolerance issue. In Our system tolerance is set up of 250. Can you please suggest how to reverse the credit memo which is incorrectly posted.
